meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes harm or injury.
meanings.sent1: The hurters in the story were the villains who wanted to harm the hero.
meanings.sent2: Doctors work hard to heal patients and protect them from hurters.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her teddy bear was a hurter trying to steal her cookies.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature, predators are the silent hurters of the weaker animals.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained that bullies are hurters who need help to change their ways.

meanings.definition: Those who cause pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The hurters in the movie were the evil characters who enjoyed causing pain.
meanings.sent2: Kindness can overcome the actions of hurters who try to bring others down.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was a little hurter, always knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the hurters were the players who tried to make their opponents lose.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to support each other against the hurters spreading rumors.

meanings.definition: Individuals who inflict harm on others.
meanings.sent1: The hurters in the story were defeated by the brave heroes who stood up to them.
meanings.sent2: It's important to teach children to recognize hurters and seek help when needed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was a little hurter, stealing nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of good versus evil, the hurters always try to bring chaos.
meanings.sent5: The community worked together to protect themselves from the hurters causing trouble.
